info.description: API to interact with CloudQuery Cloud
info.title: CloudQuery OpenAPI Spec

get.description: Health check endpoint, returns 200

post.description: Get a URL to upload image that will be publicly accessible

get.description: List all plugin notification requests

post.description: Create a new plugin notification request.

get.description: Query plugin notification request for a given plugin.

delete.description: Remove plugin notification request for a given plugin.

get.description: List all plugins

example.name: aws
example.short_description: Sync data from AWS to any destination

post.description: Create a plugin owned by the specified team. User must be part of that team.

get.description: Get details about a given plugin.

delete.description: Delete plugin by team and plugin name

get.description: List upcoming price changes for a given plugin. If the plugin has no upcoming price changes, an empty list is returned. At most one upcoming price change is returned.

post.description: Create an upcoming plugin price change. If the plugin has no upcoming price change, a new one is created. If the plugin already has an upcoming price change, this call will fail. (Delete pending price changes with the appropriate delete call.) The effective date of the price change must be at least 8 days in the future.

delete.description: Delete all pending plugin price changes.

get.description: List all versions for a given plugin
Get details about a given plugin version.

put.description: Create a new plugin version, or update a draft version

message.description:
A message describing what's new or changed in this version.
This message will be displayed to users in the plugin's changelog.
Supports limited markdown syntax.

supported_targets.description: The targets supported by this plugin version, formatted as <os>_<arch>

checksums.description: List of SHA-256 checksums for this plugin version, one for each supported target.

get.description: List all documentation pages for a given plugin version

put.description: Create or update one or more plugin version docs pages

post.description: Replace (override) multiple plugin version docs pages

delete.description: Delete one or more plugin version docs pages.

get.description: List tables for a given plugin version. This only applies to source plugins.

put.description: Create or update one or more plugin version tables. This only applies to source plugins, and can only be done if the plugin version is in draft.

delete.description: Delete one or more plugin version tables.

get.description: Get schema for a given table and plugin version. This only applies to source plugins.
Download an asset for a given plugin version and target

post.description: Get a URL to upload an asset for a given plugin version and target

get.description: List all addons

example.name: aws-policies
example.short_description: Sync data from AWS to any destination

post.description: Create an addon owned by the specified team. User must be part of that team.

get.description: Get details about a given addon.

delete.description: Delete addon by team and addon name

get.description: List all versions for a given addon
Get details about a given addon version.

put.description: Create a new addon version, or update a draft version

message.description:
A message describing what's new or changed in this version.
This message will be displayed to users in the addon's changelog.
Supports limited markdown syntax.

plugin_deps.description: plugin dependencies in the format of ['team_name/kind/plugin_name@version']

addon_deps.description: addon dependencies in the format of ['team_name/type/addon_name@version']

checksum.description: SHA-256 checksum for the addon asset

get.description: Download an asset for a given version

post.description: Get a URL to upload an asset for a given addon version

get.description: List all teams

post.description: Create a team owned by the current user.

get.description: Get a team by name

post.description: Get URLs to upload images for a given team

get.description: List all plugins for the team.

example.name: aws-source
example.short_description: Sync data from AWS to any destination

get.description: List all addons for the team.
List all addon orders for the team.

post.description: Start the checkout process for an addon order.

get.description: Get an addon order for the team.
Get memberships to the team.

delete.description: Remove a user from the team

get.description: List all monthly limits for the team.

200.description: List of monthly limits for the team.

post.description: Create a monthly limit for a plugin

get.description: Get monthly spending limit for team.

post.description: Create a spending limit for a team

put.description: Update a spending limit for a team

delete.description: Delete a spending limit for a team

get.description: Get a monthly limit for a plugin

put.description: Update a monthly limit for a plugin

delete.description: Delete a monthly limit for a plugin

get.description: List all past invoices for the team.
List plugin usage for the current calendar month.

200.description: List plugin usage for the current calendar month.

post.description: Increase the usage of a plugin. This can incur billing costs and should be used only by plugin SDKs.

204.description: Success (the plugin usage was increased). It may take some time to reflect in the usage list.

get.description: Get plugin usage for the current calendar month.

200.description: Plugin usage for the current calendar month.

get.description: Download an asset for a given plugin version as the current team.
Download an asset for a given addon version as the current team.
List of open invitations to the team

post.description: Invite a user to join a team with their email address
Accept an invitation to the team, creating a user membership

201.description: The invitation has been accepted and the authenticated user is now a member of the team.

303.description: The authenticated user is already a member of this team.

403.description: You do not have an invitation to join this team.

delete.description: Cancel an invitation to the team, preventing the user becoming a team member

get.description: List all subscription orders for the team.

post.description: Start the checkout process for a subscription order.

get.description: Get a subscription order for the team.
List all users in the current team.
Get the current authenticated user from the OAuth token

patch.description: Update attributes for the current authenticated user from the OAuth token

get.description: List of the current user's unaccepted invitations
Get memberships that the user has accepted.
List all team API Keys

post.description: Create new team API Key.

delete.description: Delete API Key. This will remove any future access by this API Key.

get.description: Performs authentication and authorization for our image registry.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Multi-value string containing the repository being access and the operation type (push/pull)

get.description: List all sync source definitions.

post.description: Create new Sync Source definition.
Test a Sync Source definition.

get.description: Get a single sync source definition.

delete.description: Delete a Sync Source definition. Any syncs relying on this source must be deleted first.

get.description: List all sync destination definitions.

post.description: Create new Sync Destination definition.
Test a Sync Destination definition.

get.description: Get a single sync destination definition.

delete.description: Delete a Sync Destination definition. Any syncs relying on this destination must be deleted first.

get.description: List all Syncs.

post.description: Create new Sync definition. Sync runs can be scheduled automatically, or triggered manually after sync is created.

get.description: Get a Sync

delete.description: Delete Sync. This will delete Sync configuration and all associated sync runs, but will not delete the associated source and destination(s). These will need to be deleted separately.

get.description: List all Sync Runs.

post.description: Create new SyncRun. This will trigger a manual job run.

get.description: Get a Sync Run.

post.description: Create a new sync run progress update.

rows.description: Number of rows synced so far

warnings.description: Number of warnings encountered so far

errors.description: Number of errors encountered so far

get.description: Get logs for a sync run.

location.description: The location to download the sync run logs from

schema.description: Chunked response logs for a sync run that is in progress.

302.description: Redirect to the logs download URL for a sync run that has completed.

get.description: Get a Sync Test Connection

TeamName.description: The unique name for the team.

PluginKind.description: The kind of plugin, ie. source or destination.

PluginName.description: The unique name for the plugin.

PluginNotificationRequestStatus.description: Status of a plugin notification request

PluginReleaseStage.description:
Official plugins can go through three release stages: Coming Soon, Preview, and GA.
The Coming Soon stage is for plugins that are not yet ready for Preview, but users can subscribe to be notified when they are ready.
Both Preview and GA plugins follow semantic versioning. The main differences between the two stages are:
Preview plugins are still experimental and may have frequent breaking changes. Preview plugins might get deprecated due to lack of usage. Long Term Support with community Discord and bug fixes is only guaranteed for GA plugins. Premium plugins are often discounted or free during the Preview stage.

official.description: True if the plugin is maintained by CloudQuery, false otherwise

short_description.example: Sync data from AWS to any destination

public.description: Whether the plugin is listed in the CloudQuery Hub. If false, the plugin will not be shown in the CloudQuery Hub and will only be visible to members of the plugin's team.

usd_per_row.description: The price per row in USD. This is used to calculate the price of a sync.

free_rows_per_month.description: The number of rows that can be synced for free each month.

minimum_cloud_version.description: Minimum plugin version that is supported in CloudQuery managed syncs.

VersionName.description: The version in semantic version format.

PluginReleaseStageCreate.description:
Official plugins can go through three release stages: Coming Soon, Preview, and GA.
The Coming Soon stage is for plugins that are not yet ready for Preview, but users can subscribe to be notified when they are ready.
Both Preview and GA plugins follow semantic versioning. The main differences between the two stages are:
Preview plugins are still experimental and may have frequent breaking changes. Preview plugins might get deprecated due to lack of usage. Long Term Support with community Discord and bug fixes is only guaranteed for GA plugins. Premium plugins are often discounted or free during the Preview stage.

display_name.description: The plugin's display name, as shown in the CloudQuery Hub.

short_description.description: Short description of the plugin. This will be shown in the CloudQuery Hub.
short_description.example: Sync data from AWS to any destination

public.description: Whether the plugin is listed in the CloudQuery Hub. If false, the plugin will not be shown in the CloudQuery Hub and will only be visible to members of the team.

logo.description: URL to the plugin's logo. This will be shown in the CloudQuery Hub. This must point to https://images.cloudquery.io/...

usd_per_row.description: The price per row in USD. This is used to calculate the price of a sync.

free_rows_per_month.description: The number of rows that can be synced for free each month.

PluginReleaseStageUpdate.description:
Official plugins can go through three release stages: Coming Soon, Preview, and GA.
The Coming Soon stage is for plugins that are not yet ready for Preview, but users can subscribe to be notified when they are ready.
Both Preview and GA plugins follow semantic versioning. The main differences between the two stages are:
Preview plugins are still experimental and may have frequent breaking changes. Preview plugins might get deprecated due to lack of usage. Long Term Support with community Discord and bug fixes is only guaranteed for GA plugins. Premium plugins are often discounted or free during the Preview stage.

display_name.description: The plugin's display name, as shown in the CloudQuery Hub.

short_description.description: Short description of the plugin. This will be shown in the CloudQuery Hub.
short_description.example: Sync data from AWS to any destination

logo.description: URL to the plugin's logo. This will be shown in the CloudQuery Hub. This must point to https://images.cloudquery.io/...

public.description: If plugin is not public, it won't be visible to other teams in the CloudQuery Hub.

usd_per_row.description: The price per row in USD. This is used to calculate the price of a sync.

free_rows_per_month.description: The number of rows that can be synced for free each month.

usd_per_row.description: The price per row in USD. This is used to calculate the price of a sync.

free_rows_per_month.description: The number of rows that can be synced for free each month.

effective_from.description: The date and time the price came (or will come) into effect.

free_rows_per_month.description: The number of rows that can be synced for free each month.

effective_from.description: The date and time the price came (or will come) into effect.

PluginProtocols.description: The CloudQuery protocols supported by this plugin version (only protocol 3 is supported by new plugins).

PluginPackageType.description: The package type of the plugin assets

created_at.description: The date and time the plugin version was created.

published_at.description: The date and time the plugin version was set to non-draft (published).

message.description: Description of what's new or changed in this version (supports markdown)
message.example: - Added support for AWS S3 - Added support for AWS EC2

draft.description: If a plugin version is in draft, it will not show to members outside the team or be counted as the latest version.

retracted.description: If a plugin version is retracted, assets will still be available for download, but the version will be marked as retracted to discourage use.

supported_targets.description: The targets supported by this plugin version, formatted as <os>_<arch>

checksums.description: The checksums of the plugin assets

PluginSpecJSONSchema.description: The specification of the plugin. This is a JSON schema that describes the configuration of the plugin.

example_config.description: Example configuration for the plugin. This can be used in generated quickstart guides, for example. Markdown format.

message.description: Description of what's new or changed in this version (supports markdown)
message.example: - Added support for *AWS S3* - Added support for *AWS EC2*

draft.description: If a plugin version is in draft, it will not show to members outside the team or be counted as the latest version. Once draft is set to false, only certain fields can be updated.

retracted.description: If a plugin version is retracted, assets will still be available for download, but the version will be marked as retracted to discourage use.

checksums.description: The SHA-256 checksums of the plugin binaries, one per supported target.

package_type.description: The package type of the plugin binaries

PluginDocsPageName.description: The unique name for the plugin documentation page.

content.description: The content of the documentation page. Supports markdown.
content.example:
# Getting Started

This is the getting started page.

content.description: The content of the documentation page. Supports markdown.
content.example:
# Getting Started

This is the getting started page.

parent.description: Name of the parent table, if any

relations.description: Names of the tables that depend on this table

updated_at.description: The date and time the plugin limit was last updated.

usd.description: The maximum USD amount the plugin is allowed to use within a calendar month.

MonthlyLimitCreate.description: A configurable monthly limit for plugin usage.

usd.description: The maximum USD amount the plugin is allowed to use within a calendar month.

updated_at.description: The date and time the team limit was last updated.

usd.description: The maximum USD amount the team is allowed to use within a calendar month.

MonthlyLimitUpdate.title: CloudQuery Plugin Monthly Limit
MonthlyLimitUpdate.description: A configurable monthly limit for plugin usage.

usd.description: The maximum USD amount the plugin is allowed to use within a calendar month.

amount_due.description: Amount due in cents. This is the amount that will be charged, unless there are pending invoice items. If the invoices total is smaller than the minimum charge amount, for example, or if there is account credit that can be applied to the invoice, the amount_due may be 0. The charge that gets generated for the invoice will be for the amount specified in amount_due.

invoice_pdf.description: The link to download the PDF for the invoice.

paid.description: Whether or not payment was successfully collected for this invoice.

UsageCurrent.title: CloudQuery Plugin Usage
UsageCurrent.description: The usage of a plugin within the current calendar month.

rows.description: The number of rows used by the plugin in the calendar month.

usd.description: The USD amount used by the plugin in the calendar month, rounded to two decimal places.

remaining_usd.description: The remaining USD amount in the plugin's quota for the calendar month.

remaining_rows.description: The estimated number of rows remaining in the plugin's quota for the calendar month at the current price per row. This includes both free and paid rows up to the monthly limit defined for the plugin.

UsageIncrease.title: CloudQuery Plugin Usage Increase
UsageIncrease.description: Increase the usage of a plugin. This can incur billing costs and should be used only by plugins.

rows.description: The additional rows used by the table.
The total number of additional rows used by the plugin.

request_id.description: A unique ID associated with the usage increase.

TeamSubscriptionOrderID.description: ID of the team subscription order

completion_url.description: Stripe URL for completing purchase. Only shown in response to POST request when a paid plan is selected.

success_url.description: URL to redirect to after successful order completion

cancel_url.description: URL to redirect to after order cancellation

token.description: The token used to accept the invitation

APIKeyScope.description: Scope of permissions for the API key. API keys are used for creating new plugin versions and downloading existing plugins

APIKey.description: API Key to interact with CloudQuery Cloud under specific team

created_by.description: email of the user that created the API key

key.description: API key. Will be shown only in the response when creating the key.

expires_at.description: Timestamp at which API key will stop working

expired.description: Whether the API key has expired or not

RegistryAuthToken.description: JWT token for the image registry

SyncSourceCreate.title: Sync Source definition for creating a new source

name.description: Descriptive, unique name for the source. The name can only contain ASCII letters, digits, - and _.

tables.description: Tables to sync. Wildcards are supported. Note that child tables are excluded by default, and need to be explicitly specified.

skip_tables.description: Tables matched by `tables` that should be skipped. Wildcards are supported.

spec.format: Plugin parameters, specific to each plugin

env.description: Environment variables for the plugin. All environment variables will be stored as secrets.

SyncEnv.description: Environment variable. Environment variables are assumed to be secret.

created_at.description: Time when the source was created

updated_at.description: Time when the source was last updated

env.description: Environment variables for the plugin. All environment variables will be stored as secrets.

name.description: Descriptive, unique name for the sync. The name can only contain ASCII letters, digits, - and _.
